result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Carol L Nitka was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Carol L Nitka in court with attorney Brian Severson.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1 in 14 CF 271 and Ct. 1 in 14 CF 301, Judgment to be entered 14 CF 271, Ct. 2 dismissed and 14 CF 301, Ct. 2 and Ct. 3 dismissed,  14 CF 271, Ct. 1, Court withholds sentence, probation 5 years, 6 months jail w/Huber, Huber for work and treatment purposes, Good Time granted, Jail start date 1/30/15 at 4:30 P.M., $2,198.00 fine/costs, 36 month D.L. revocation, AODA and comply, DNA Sample and $250.00 DNA Surcharge to be provided, 36 month ignition interlock device, not possess/consume alcohol, 2 days sentence credit, 14 CF 301, Ct. 1, Court withholds sentence, probation 5 years, $518.00 costs, AODA and comply, defendant to provide DNA Sample, not possess/consume alcohol, 7 days sentence credit, bond to be applied, 14 TR 3494R dismissed,
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 30, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Carol L Nitka by video, in custody with attorney Gregory W Sacra.  Christine M Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  $1500.00 signature bond.  Not to go upon the premises where alcohol is sold for on-site consumption.  Maintain absolute sobriety.   Absolute sobriety while operating a motor vehicle.  Standard felony conditions.  Waives time limits.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 02:00 pm.  Hearing scheduled for August 6, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
